post.title: Meme
post.contents:
# Meme

A meme is an idea that is a [replicator]. Memes can also form a memeplex that is a group of memes that help to cause each other's replication[^tboi].

## Types of Memes

- **Rational**: an idea that relies on the recipients' critical faculties to cause itself to be replicated[^tboi].
- **Anti-rational**: an idea that replies on disabling the recipients' critical faculties to cause itself to be replicated[^tboi].

## Replication of Memes

Since there can be no replication of knowledge without interpretation _(needs expansion)_, it also plays a vital component in the replication of memes, as [creativity] is required to faithfully replicate, e.g. a teacher's explanation of how multiplication works, inside of our own minds[^awoich2].

[^tboi]: Deutsch, The Beginning of Infinity.
[^awoich2]: Hackethal, A Window on Intelligence: The Philosophy of People, Software, and Evolution â€“ and Its Implications, Chapter 2.

[creativity]: ./creativity.md
[replicator]: ./replicator.md

inboundLinks.context: An abstraction which, once instantiated physically, tends to cause itself to remain so by contributing to its copying. Examples of replicators are: ideas or **meme**s (the golden rule), genes (outrun predators).
inboundLinks.title: Replicator
